name: 1.1 - The current revision of drawings are being used including subcontractors copy.
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawings are being used, including the subcontractors copy. Current revision to be obtained via Aconex
Reference Documents - Current Revision Drawings in Aconex
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Prior to the Works, the Contractor must provide the Contract Administrator and Principal’s Design Consultant with a fully detailed dilapidation survey recording the current condition of aircraft pavements, aircraft pavement surface features, underground services, roads, drives, footpaths and adjoining premises.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl1.23.1
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must submit a methodology of service detection to the Contract Administrator for review.
• Within 20m of intrusive works the Contractor must locate and mark the ground position of all underground services and structures.
• Services located within the works area must be exposed using hand tools or specialist sensitive excavation techniques (NDD).
• This methodology is contained within the work procedure for demolition.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl3.2.1 & AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl3.2.2
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer Contract Administrator

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must prepare a Demolition Work Plan and shall submit this plan to the Contract Administrator at least ten (10) business days prior to the works commencing for approval.
• The Contractor must maintain pavements surrounding the demolition site in a clean condition that is free from debris and saw and core cuttings, slurry etc
• Precautions to protect the existing remaining pavement from damage must be undertaken where tracked equipment are required to traverse or operate on existing pavement.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl4.5 & AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl4.6.3
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer Contract Administrator

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor needs to obtain all required works approval from the Principal as required. This must include excavations, hot works, electrical isolation permits and crane access. Evidence of permits being obtained by the Contractor must be submitted to the Contract Administrator prior to works commencing.
• Fulton Hogan Excavation permit issued to plant operators.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl4.4
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer Contract Administrator
1.6 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation that Services Detection has been Completed for the Works area(s)
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl3.3.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - If contaminated or hazardous materials are found, immediate notice is to be given to the Principal’s Representative. These include the following;
• Flammable or explosive liquids or gases;
• Tanks or other containers which have been used for storage of explosive, toxic, infective or contaminated substances.

○ A proposal for the procedure to remove contaminated or hazardous materials from the site to be agreed between FH, APAM and AECOM in accordance with all statutory and contractual requirements to approved locations.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl1.19
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator
Acceptance Criteria - The disposal of demolished materials is to be managed under the approved Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP).
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAP MP 2.0 Spec. Cl4.6.5
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor to make the area safe and clean post completion of works. Any temporary supports are to be removed at completion of demolition.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
